intro: Bunchosia cuscana, commonly known as the silky bush or silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its fibrous stems and capsule fruits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
